title: Citrus lemon orange mandarin grafting  Tree grafting technique # 91

tasks.task: Unloading hay from the truck onto the farm.
subtasks: Approach the truck carrying hay bales.
Open the truck bed doors carefully.
Grasp a hay bale securely with both arms.
Lift the hay bale out of the truck bed, lowering it to the ground.
Repeat for each hay bale until the truck is empty.

tasks.task: Stacking hay bales on the designated spot on the farm.
subtasks: Walk to the stacking area with the first hay bale.
Lower the hay bale onto the existing stack, ensuring stability.
Continue stacking each bale, aligning them neatly on top of the previous.
Maintain balance while placing each bale to prevent collapse.

tasks.task: Checking the alignment and stability of the hay stack.
subtasks: Step back from the stack to assess its overall structure.
Inspect edges and corners for any protruding bales that might tip over.
Look for any gaps between bales that could affect stability.
Confirm the stack is even, with no uneven sides.

tasks.task: Ensuring the correct placement of the hay stack for immediate use or storage.
subtasks: Observe the need for the hay (e.g., livestock feeding schedule).
Choose a spot that is dry and sheltered from the elements.
If storing, verify the stack is near the barn or storage shed.
If for immediate use, check proximity to the animals or livestock area.
